Cuban Embassy Officials Visit Political University of Ministry of People's Security 
    Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Ruben Perez Valdes, Cuban ambassador to the DPRK, and staff members of the Cuban embassy visited Political University of the Ministry of People's Security on April 18 on the occasion of the 45th anniversary of the victory of the Cuban people in the  Playa Giron battle.
 They laid bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the university and paid tribute to him. Then, they went round an indoor firing range, being briefed on the history of the university associated with the leadership exploits performed by the three generals of Mt. Paektu.    
 At the end of the visit, the Cuban ambassador wrote in the visitor's book that they would resolutely fight against the U.S. imperialist aggressors alongside the Korean people, always holding arms in their hands.

articles.content:
DPRK Young Women Footballers Prove Successful
    Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK young woman football team proved successful at the 3rd Asian Women Football Championships (16-18) to be qualified to participate in the 3rd World Women Football Championships (16-18).
 The Asian championships held in Kuala Lumpur between Apr. 8 and 18 brought together young women football teams from 8 Asian and Oceanic countries and regions.
 The DPRK team placed second to be qualified for participating in the 3rd World Women Football Championships (16-18) to be held in Russia in August this year.

articles.title: Cambodian King Visits Venue of 8th Kimilsungia Festival
articles.content:
Cambodian King Visits Venue of 8th Kimilsungia Festival
    Pyongyang, April 19 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni Wednesday visited the venue of the 8th Kimilsungia Festival.
 He was accompanied by his suite members and Chhorn Hay, Cambodian ambassador to the DPRK.    
 He was greeted there by Kang Nung Su, chairman of the Korean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee, Kim Jin Song, minister of Culture, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and Choe Han Chun, DPRK ambassador to Cambodia.
 The king looked round with keen interest the photos, "Grand" prix, the highest prize, and its certificate the immortal flower received at the World Botanical Expo, and special prize and gold medal it won at the International Flower Show displayed in the room for information service on the flower and the venue of the festival full of beautiful Kimilsungias.    
 At the end of the visit he wrote in the visitor's book:
 "I and my entourage are very pleased to visit the grand Kimilsungia festival hall.
 The Kimilsungia festival is a historic one fully showing the particular relations HE Generalissimo Kim Il Sung established with leaders of different countries of the world.
 The Kimilsungia festival strikingly shows the single-minded unity of the Korean people provided by the great leader HE Generalissimo Kim Il Sung."
